description: T1 - ceanothus tree (4m) - reduce height by up to 1m and shape sides. T2 - bay tree (7m) - trim with hedge cutters to reduce crown by up to 1m into dome shape with a flat bottom edge. T3 - pear tree (8m) - reduce crown by up to 1.5m and remove epicormic shoots from main stem. T4 - sycamore tree (12m) - remove dead climbing rose. (May be able to do with poles) T5 - gleditsia tree (8m) - reduce side of crown over garden by up to 2m to balance crown. T6 - quince tree (4m) - thin by 20% and shape to balance crown. T7 - dead cercis tree (3m) - take down to ground level. T8 - mulberry tree (8m) - reduce crown to previous pruning points, approximately 1m reduction. Front - T9 - horse chestnut tree - remove epicormic shoots from main stem up to 3m from ground level to stop blocking of pavement.
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
